page.title: 15Employment
page.content: This part of the Lake District National Park is extremely picturesque and it follows that many of the occupations are fitting to the area. { {The National Trust}and{The Planning {Board}employ many people, and both have information centres in Hawkshead. {The Forestry Commission, The Slate {Quarries}and the{Council}are also major employers. There are tradesmen such as milkmen, joiners, decorators, plumbers, builders, engineers, mechanics and postmen. Hotel and cafe workers, shop assistants and campsites all depend on tourism and some employees are 'laid off' in winter. There is a doctor, a butcher, baker, hairdresser and many artists. A chemist, post office, magistrates court, two banks and many farms all provide local employment. There are also many retired people.
